<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Typo/mispelling in the .es Spanish version of 
username_0: **Describe the bug**

<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
The current word "implulsa" is a typo/misspelling. It is not a word in any language.

The correct word should be "impulsa", as it "powers the ethere cryptocurrency"

This is on line 6 of the page-index.json file.

[https://github.com/ethereum/ethereum-org-website/blob/c7546d01d825e6e4e8d037112d6f0327f947dc22/src/intl/es/page-index.json#L6](https://github.com/ethereum/ethereum-org-website/blob/c7546d01d825e6e4e8d037112d6f0327f947dc22/src/intl/es/page-index.json#L6)

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Go to '[...](https://ethereum.org/es/)'
2.  See error in the `Ethereum es la tecnolog√≠a de gesti√≥n comunitaria que implulsa la criptomoneda ether (ETH) y miles de aplicaciones descentralizadas.`

**Expected behavior**

<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->

**Screenshots**

<!-- If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. -->

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**

- OS: [e.g. iOS]
- Browser: [e.g. chrome, safari]
- Version: [e.g. 22]

**Smartphone (please complete the following information):**

- Device: [e.g. iPhone6]
- OS: [e.g. iOS8.1]
- Browser: [e.g. stock browser, safari]
- Version: [e.g. 22]

**Additional context**

<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. -->

**Want to contribute?**

We love contributions from the Ethereum community! Please comment on an issue if you're interested in helping out with a PR.
<issue_comment>username_0: I'd do the PR if I knew how, but am not sure I have the permissions or know-how to submit it.  Happy to learn if someone wants to show me how.
<issue_comment>username_1: @username_0 You can follow this [instructions](https://github.com/ethereum/ethereum-org-website#how-to-contribute) to set up your development environment and create the PR. If you have any questions I will be happy to help you. If you do not want to do it, I can create the PR for you üôÇ
<issue_comment>username_0: Okay, cool.  Go ahead and assign the issue to me.  

Let's see if I can't get the switches and gears of github moving in such a way to make this simple fix and PR.
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_1 , I'm thru the initial steps, and up to this one:
**Set up your local environment (optional)**

1) If it is "optional", not sure I need all this next bit of complexity. Or do I?
Question:  is it "advisable" for me to do this set of steps? 

2) I use a WinOS computer.   I'm not sure how to `run` commands shown like:
`$ git remote add upstream https://github.com/ethereum/ethereum-org-website.git` on a WinOS machine.  
I do know how to use the command line window, and ran DOS stuff a lot back in the 1980s/90s, but those commands look Unix-ish to me, so I'm quite unsure if they'll run in Win, and how I need to set up the directories and permissions to get them to run smoothly on WinOS.
<issue_comment>username_1: 1) I believe you can just skip that, I never set that up and I did not run into any problems. 
2) That is just a regular git command. I do not use windows, but you can use bash for it. Or maybe install windows linux subsystem?
<issue_comment>username_0: Thanks @username_1 .  Will skip that entire "optional" step.

But "bash" is not in my vocabulary, so hard to know what is involved, if I wanted to follow your next 
instruction:  "`you can use an external bash for it."
<issue_comment>username_1: It means to create a new branch in git for your changes. The sample code is shown below in the step: `git checkout -b new_branch_name`
<issue_comment>username_1: Hey @username_0! Were you able to figure it out?
<issue_comment>username_0: I've been working at it.  Have done 
`winget` ...
and even got some sort of `git` for WinOS installed, 
so I now have Apps I can open called
`Git GUI`
`Git CMD` , and 
`Git Bash`  (although I still have no idea what "bash" is.
<issue_comment>username_0: But I have not been able to figure out how to get all those various cmd line strings that are thrown around operating in my environment. 

I probably need to work in a coworking environment for a while, adjacent to an experienced Git and Github person, who is sorta kinda a little bit familiar with WinOS.    I need a sherpa.

Given I don't work in or around anyone like that, maybe it is time for me to just give up and let someone else fix that spelling error.  :(
<issue_comment>username_0: So, bottom line, I still don't know how to `run` commands shown like:
`$ git remote add upstream https://github.com/ethereum/ethereum-org-website.git` on my WinOS machine.
<issue_comment>username_0: So you should just go ahead and submit the fix.  Will make the ethereum.org website better in the quickest and most efficient way.
<issue_comment>username_0: I got a LOT farther when I opened that `Git GUI` app on WindowsOS.

I might have even got that "git remote add upstream https://github.com/ethereum/ethereum-org-website.git` line to run, after I typed it in following a `$` cmd line prompt.

And I could even `browse` the file I want to update:  `src/intl/es/page-index.json`
where I want to fix the spelling of one word in line 6.

But I could never figure out how to edit just that single line.

And if I did, not sure what would then turn it into a PR on github.


But I ultimately could not figure out how to
<issue_comment>username_1: @username_0 I have opened the PR for you üôÇ
<issue_comment>username_2: Thanks for the report @username_0 ‚ù§Ô∏è @all-contributors please add @username_0 for bug reports<issue_closed>

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: 3.3 Facilitate censorship measurement workshops
username_0: To empower community participation in censorship measurement research, we will facilitate censorship measurement workshops for human rights defenders, lawyers, journalists, policy researchers, and advocates. 

The aim of these workshops is to introduce these communities to OONI‚Äôs methodologies so that they can help with more stable, diverse, and long-term deployments, as well as with relevant research and advocacy efforts based on OONI data. The workshops would discuss best practices when creating and maintaining test lists, the exact nature of tests and what insight they can provide, and how to use OONI censorship measurement data as part of research and advocacy.<issue_closed>
<issue_comment>username_0: This is done!

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Migrate to BrowserSync ^2.0.0
username_0: The upgrade path is seamless for this project and requires no action, however before I send a PR will you be wanting the UI disabled by default, perhaps with a commented line advising people that it's there? 

Info - [http://www.wearejh.com/news/browsersync-2-0/](http://www.wearejh.com/news/browsersync-2-0/)
Option docs - [http://www.browsersync.io/docs/options](http://www.browsersync.io/docs/options)
<issue_comment>username_1: Given the UI is installed by default, do you know ~ how much larger this makes the dependency tree?

I would go ahead with a PR and we'll continue local testing. Will comment back if we have further questions.

Cheers! :)
<issue_comment>username_1: Fyi, appears to be a small rendering issue in your docs http://www.browsersync.io/docs/gulp/ :)
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_1 - dependencies are always a valid concern - true. The UI is extremely light-weight though, and were it not for `weinre`, the tree for the UI would only be a single level.

![deps](http://cl.ly/image/3m311a3s2Q2j/Screen%20Shot%202015-02-10%20at%2016.26.01.png)

That being said, I am absolutely thinking about having a BrowserSync-lite for power-users who really only want the sync/live reload. This would be trivial to implement as the entire UI, whilst bundled, is actually just a BrowserSync plugin.

Interested to hear everyones opinions :)
<issue_comment>username_0: also, good catch with the docs rendering, all fixed now :)
<issue_comment>username_2: Many tools go with a `module-core` for the core functionality and `module` for everything. I could see the use for `browsersync-core` and `browsersync` (which depends on `browsersync-core`).
<issue_comment>username_1: From my testing the UI is available, but isn't loaded to the end-user by default. They have to manually navigate to the URL for it in order to access, which feels okay to me.
<issue_comment>username_0: Yeah I decided against forcing it to be opened by default. For anyone wondering though, the `open` option takes any availableurl, so to open the UI instead of the default:

```
browserSync({
    server: "./app",
    open: "ui" //or `ui-external`
});
```
<issue_comment>username_3: This is fixed in https://github.com/google/web-starter-kit/commit/d7b0b9b249fc6e11f3c617067e06ce6b6eb67561
<issue_comment>username_1: Thanks for the reminder, @username_3!<issue_closed>
<issue_comment>username_0: :+1:  - enjoy :)
<issue_comment>username_1: Appreciate the updates once again, @username_0!

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Make Windows requirements more specific
username_0: In a follow-up PR we will add a check to flutter_tools to fail if PowerShell 5.0 is not installed.

Preparation for https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/11698

/cc @pq
<issue_comment>username_0: Build failure is flutter/flutter#15293, which is unrelated to this PR.
<issue_comment>username_0: Waiting on https://github.com/flutter/website/pull/916, which fixes the build.
<issue_comment>username_0: Closing this in favor of https://github.com/flutter/website/pull/917 due to some travis problem.

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Issue with k8s.io/docs/tutorials/kubernetes-basics/create-cluster/cluster-interactive/
username_0: **This is a Bug Report**

<!-- Thanks for filing an issue! Before submitting, please fill in the following information. -->
<!-- See https://kubernetes.io/docs/contribute/start/ for guidance on writing an actionable issue description. -->

<!--Required Information-->
**Problem:**

LOG>
$ minikube start

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: istioctl analyze messages documentation
username_0: This adds a documentation page for each of the istioctl analyzer messages.
<issue_comment>username_0: Please ignore the linter failure, it's due to temporary 404s explained on their web site:

"Due to the fires and power outages in California, oreilly.com is unavailable."
<issue_comment>username_1: @username_0 @sushicw what's blocking this PR? I have some changes I would like to make on top of this content so I'm hoping we can get this merged soon.
<issue_comment>username_2: Please rebase in order to fix the CI failure.
<issue_comment>username_0: /retest

I have tried to contact the author of this installation script via PSGallery.
The author seems to have been inactive for a while, so it is possible that this bug would not be fixed quickly.

Maybe we can write a new one.', 'title': 'Wrong URI in PSGallery Installation Script', 'type': 'issue'}

column6:
<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Wrong URI in PSGallery Installation Script
username_0: ```

**Page to Update:**
https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/tools/install-kubectl-windows/#install-with-powershell-from-psgallery

I have tried to contact the author of this installation script via PSGallery.
The author seems to have been inactive for a while, so it is possible that this bug would not be fixed quickly.

I want to fix it (with just one-line-change) but cannot because this script is not licensed openly.
Maybe we can write a new one.
<issue_comment>username_1: Let's track this at https://github.com/kubernetes/website/issues/26956

/close

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Add mission statement to learning team
username_0: ‚ÄúEmpowering Ember users to learn, build, and teach.‚Äù 

Integrate this into the description of the learning team on the /team page. Content may need to be edited for brevity.
<issue_comment>username_1: @username_0, I've submitted a simple pull request at https://github.com/emberjs/website/pull/3298.
<issue_comment>username_2: @username_0 Not sure if this PR has been updated but I could help if you want?
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_2 thanks for checking! That would be great- can you look at PR 3298 and help it over the finish line? Thank you!! :+1:

<issue_comment>username_4: Thanks @username_3 it was<issue_closed>

column6: Title: Support markdown autolinks with Markdown Render Hooks username_0: ``` Hugo 0.62.0 ``` Given this render-link.html code ``` {{ .Text | safeHTML }} ``` [Markdown auto links](https://spec.commonmark.org/0.29/#autolinks) are currently not supported. In: ``` ``` Out: ``` http:/test.com ``` In (works as expected): ``` [Test](http:/test.com) ``` Out: ``` Test ``` Thank you! username_1: Goldmark seems to support an even more freeform GFM autolinks without any delimiters https://github.github.com/gfm/#autolinks-extension- Also completely un-marked-up link is a convention for automated embeds and having them run through hook would be very powerful for that purpose. Think lone twitter link by itself getting turned into full embedded tweet. username_0: Thanks a lot for v0.63.0! This issue seems to be solved now, too‚Äîat least in all my use cases. username_3: It doesn't seem to be fixed for me. Autolinks still don't invoke the render hook... username_2: ``` Hugo 0.62.0 ``` Given this render-link.html code ``` {{ .Text | safeHTML }} ``` [Markdown auto links](https://spec.commonmark.org/0.29/#autolinks) are currently not supported. In: ``` ``` Out: ``` http:/test.com ``` In (works as expected): ``` [Test](http:/test.com) ``` Out: ``` Test ``` Thank you! username_4: I am on 0.71 and it has not been fixed so far. username_5: **0.80** is out and it still does not work. Workaround: if you want to use hook for adding "`target=_blank"` in your URLs, use different markdown provider in your `config.toml`: ````toml [markup] defaultMarkdownHandler = "blackFriday" [markup.blackFriday] hrefTargetBlank = true ````` username_6: To clarify, this is an autolink: ``` ``` And with: ``` [markup.goldmark.extensions] linkify = true ``` These are also autolinks: ``` www.gohugo.io https://www.gohugo.io ``` username_6: Fixed with https://github.com/gohugoio/hugo/pull/8756
